966.8: [Nozdormu] This place holds many mysteries, | but few answers.
966.10: [Nozdormu] One who would be your guide. | Tell me, what do you remember from before?
966.12: [Emberthal] My general. | A fierce battle. | And then I was... | imprisoned, in darkness.
966.13: [Nozdormu] Hmm. | But now you are free.
966.15: [Nozdormu] Come. | There is much I would show you, | to prepare you | for the challenges that lie ahead.
966.17: [Emberthal] This place... | So strange. | Where are we?
966.19: Many thousands of years ago, | when our world was... young, | Azeroth was home | to the ancestors of dragons - | primitive beasts | ruled by primal instincts. | Yet there were a few in whom | the spark of intelligence was lit, | who thought, spoke and felt | more deeply than the rest.
966.20: [Emberthal] What does this | have to do with me?
966.21: [Nozdormu] Were it not for them, | your people would not be. | From these proto-dragons, | there arose the monster Galakrond...
966.24: [Nozdormu] ...whose insatiable hunger | would have consumed us all.
966.26: [Nozdormu] When the fate | of our kind was at stake, | we five overcame the instincts | of fear and self-preservation, | and united to battle the leviathan.
966.27: [Emberthal] "We"? | So, you were one of these.
966.30: [Nozdormu] For our bravery, | risking everything to save the world, | we were granted a gift of the Titans - | transformed into something greater.
966.32: Together, we became the Aspects, | leaders of the dragonflights, | the protectors of Azeroth. | In time, we took on visages like this, | to better commune with the younger races.
966.33: [Emberthal] Why have you shown me this?
966.34: [Nozdormu] I am Nozdormu. | I was Aspect of the bronzeflight. | It is my fate to see all of time. | But now a threat to our world approaches. | An ancient enemy has returned. | You will play a part in the events to come, | and you will have to make | a difficult choice, | as we did.
966.36: [Nozdormu] No. | My story is already written, | but yours, and that of all Dracthyr, | is only beginning to unfold.

967.4: [Emberthal] Emberthal, | a commander of the dracthyr. | You know of us?
967.5: [Nozdormu] You are a race | of fierce warriors | unlike anything Azeroth | has seen in many an age. | In time, you may become | as mighty as we once were.
967.7: [Nozdormu] The desire for power | carries peril. | We were blind | to the darkness in our midst. | Behold the Dragon Isles. | In the time after our ascension, | we aspects sought to create | a beacon of hope for all the world.
967.9: [Nozdormu] Indeed, | we all had our roles to play. | Guided by Alexstrasza - | our conscience, our heart - | we all became as close as clutchmates... | or so it seemed.
967.11: [Nozdormu] For we could not hear | the whispers of corruption | that tempted one of our own. | When demons invaded our world, | we aspects went forth to protect it | as we always had, | not knowing whether we would ever again | see the shores of home.
967.12: Our brother Neltharion led our defense | against the invaders. | But for the first time, | we found our strength... inadequate. | And we grew desperate. | So when Neltharion assured us | that with our help | he could forge a weapon to win the war, | we placed our trust in him.
967.13: And we renewed our battle | against the demons, | only to have Neltharion - | who now took the name “Deathwing” - | turn on his own kind. | We could not foresee this betrayal | for we simply did not want to believe. | Even after all this time, | the pain of his treachery is far worse | than the scars he left us with.
967.14: [Emberthal] That is not the leader | I remember! | How do I know it was not you | who provoked him?
967.15: You missed much during your confinement. | But the Sands of Time reveal all truths, | child, even bitter ones. | Trust your eyes.
967.17: [Nozdormu] When the Champions of Azeroth | faced Deathwing for the last time, | he was so consumed by madness | that he could not imagine | what we would sacrifice to stop him, | that the weapon we had helped him forge | would become the means of his destruction.
967.21: Deathwing would have destroyed this world. | To stop him, | we aspects relinquished our power, | our immortality, | our guardianship of Azeroth itself. | A fair trade, I believe.
967.22: [Emberthal] You want something from me, | don’t you?
967.23: It is my gift - and my burden - | to travel the pathways of time. | But there is one crucial moment | that has long remained hidden from me... | and only you can lead me there.

968.2: [Emberthal] [exhales heavily] | Nozdormu, wait. | You have led me through | all these moments in time, | yet now you ask me to guide you?
968.3: There is a blind spot in my vision | of a time before Neltharian's corruption | and I believe it centers upon you. | I must know why. | Seek him out in your memory.
968.4: [Emberthal] [echoing] My general. | A fierce battle. And then I was... | It was my honor to command a battalion. | We executed Neltharion's will precisely. | Our devotion and discipline | were unmatched.
968.5: [Nozdormu] A Titan artifact! | That must be the source of your unity. | This was an ancient magic | that bound you to his will. | Would you not | sacrifice yourselves at his whim?
968.6: [Emberthal] We were soldiers! | There were many threats to the world.
968.8: [Emberthal] And here was the greatest: | the Primalists.
968.9: [Nozdormu] That is Raszageth, | the Storm-Eater... | one of the leaders | of the Primalist rebellion.
968.10: [Emberthal] They struck without warning. | Without honor. | And I lost many friends this day. | We fell back, regrouped. | But then... | everything became jumbled, confused.
968.11: [Nozdormu] The artifact... destroyed. | And the order-magic which had united | the dracthyr was dispelled.
968.13: So, brother, this is what you hid from us: | the moment you fell from grace. | In his desperation, | he turned to the deepest evil: | the power of the Old Gods. | If only we had known?
968.14: [Emberthal] But then... | why were we imprisoned? | Why did we sleep for so long?
968.15: If he could no longer | control the dracthyr, | he would have deemed you a risk.
968.16: [Emberthal] No. We laid down our lives | for him. He was proud of us! | Why would he-- stop this sand! | I cannot see!
968.17: Because you do not want to! | Yet you can only become more than you are | if you confront your past!
968.20: So he locked us away. | Forgot we even existed. | It would have been kinder | to simply destroy us.
968.21: I am sorry, my young friend.
968.22: We had to know the truth.
968.23: But do not despair. | I now believe that Neltharion | locked you away | because of what you might become.
968.24: [Emberthal] What we might achieve | free of his control.
968.25: And now you are free. | This world has much to offer, | and you will have a part to play | in the events to come.
968.26: [Emberthal] You spoke | of an ancient enemy's return. | It is Raszageth and the Primalists. | That is why we were awakened.
968.27: It seems that Neltharion | yet had a purpose for you. | But he is gone. | You must decide which path you will take, | which story you will tell.
968.28: [Emberthal] My story... will be my own.
